oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Beef Quality Assurance Through Usage of Critical Control Points
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Devin, T. M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Quality Assurance
Implants
Biologicals
Pharmaceuticals
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Since the National Beef Quality Audit in 1994, much progress has been made in reducing targeted defects. In just 6 years, top butt injection site lesions have been reduced from 22 to 6 percent. However, much remains to be done in the education of producers at all levels of the beef production chain.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1998; 258
